intro: Cohnia, commonly known as the water plantain, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Alismataceae. It typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes, ponds, and along the edges of streams. The plants have long, narrow leaves that are often submerged or floating, and they produce small, white or greenish flowers. Cohnia species are characterized by their rhizomatous growth and ability to thrive in aquatic or semi-aquatic conditions. These plants play an important role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
